intro: Barbacenia flava var. minor, commonly known as the yellow barbacenia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its vibrant yellow flowers and hairy stems. It thrives in warm, humid climates and requires well-drained soil. Barbacenia flava var. minor is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and greenhouses.
